content.description: Short route that trends left. Sharp crimpy crux starts near 2nd bolt. Eases off towards the top.
content.location: Farthest right route on the brickwall. starts on bolts just right of offwidth

content.description: Climb a steep face on fun crimps and pinches to a bulge with a good rest below it. Climb the bulge on ever increasing sized holds to broken ground and then the top. Climbing over the bulge is exposed, airy, and really fun. Technical crux is getting passed a less featured spot low on the route, but the bulge will get the heart racing.
content.location: Second bolted route from left on the face proper. Left of orange streak( know as Jeep Streak 12a)

content.description: Climb the face and arete through several tricky sections. This takes a beautiful line on the edge of the cliff. Although this is graded similar to Power Flyer, it seemed much harder.
content.location: First bolted route from the left on the face proper.

content.description: Fun moves. Multiple crux moves. One of the better routes on the brick wall.
content.protection: Bolts and ring anchors at top.
content.location: Just right of Dreams(the left facing corner on left side of brick wall).

content.description: Pumpy 5.9 left angling offwidth crack. start with laybacks and keep moving to avoid the pump. you can throw in knee bars if you need a rest.
content.protection: even with a #6 BD cam it gets scary. i would reccomend toproping this route off the anchors of Virus and turn onto the face when a pendulum fall looks likely.
content.location: Obvious Offwidth crack on right side of brick wall.

content.description: Sustained 5.9. Crux is first few moves that shuts a lot of people down. Lots of layback moves, and pretty pumpy.
content.protection: Takes all sizes, but nothing bigger than #2 BD cam if you look for the right placements.
content.location: Obvious crack system in middle of wall.

content.description: Good moves, small crimps, and long reaches. Crux is at the third bolt. When mantling the ledge dont reach for the top of Offwidth, it makes it too easy. Catch your breath on the ledge, and fire off the 10 ft boulder problem to the anchors.
content.location: Bolted line just to the right of No Name

content.description: Start just left of the off width and follow the rail up and left to the ledge.  Then pull the boulder problem off of the ledge to the anchor.

Cool little roof crack thingy features steep liebacking hand jamming and the best part is the no hands bathang at the lip for fun. It'd be a good climb for strong climbers just starting trad climbing since the pro is so easy to place and it's short.
content.protection: one each .75 through #3 camalot is adequate. Double up on the #1 or #2 if desired
content.location: 100 feet right of the brick wall

content.description: follow orange streak to the top. going left or right out of the orange makes it easier than 12a. sustained but crux is just before the bulge.
content.protection: bolts with ring anchors at the top.
content.location: route starts just right of power flyer on flat boulder.

content.description: Squeezed between Epidemic & Comfortably Numb, this route follows crimps, a sidepull crux, more crimps, and sloping jugs to the top.
content.protection: 5 bolts, 2 ring bolt anchors   Consider a .75 C4 or similar for the top.

content.description: Dont fall on the way to the first bolt. Was bolted with the third bolt way left of the bolt line, but has since been corrected.
content.protection: Bolts and shares ring anchors with Plague.
content.location: Just right of Plague. Look for big root coming out of the ground below the first bolt.

content.description: overhanging route with crux 2/3 up the route. follows thin crack with left hand and arete for the right.
content.location: left of pigs on a wing. only bolted route on this overhanging wall

content.description: great layback crack climb. fingers to very thin fingers. crux is at end of the crack where you move right onto the face well above small gear.
content.protection: small cams. bring #1 bd with 2ft sling for top. shares ring anchors with Jeep Streak
content.location: starts just right of orange streak on left side of wall at obvious left facing corner.

content.description: This dirt fest may appear to be a perfect hands roof splitter, but climber beware! Prepare for dirt, slime, and mud, as you pull some sort of neat moves and crank a burly lip. Maybe if it cleans up, it will be as worth doing as Jesus Lives. Probably not...
content.location: On top of the brick wall. Look for what appears to be a roof crack.

content.description: Crimp moves and side pulls to horizontal. Horizontal seeps sometimes but is generally off route. From horizontal straight up with side pull crux.
content.location: Just left of Brickhouse. Directly behind a tree.

content.description: Crux is low, moving from big horizontal crack to sloping side pull pinch thing to gain crack system. once feet are on horizontal crack the route eases
content.protection: one bolt on direct start. small trad gear.
content.location: in between comfortably numb and no name crack. direct start located by single bolt 10 foot off the ground. original start is just right.

content.description: The Brick Wall is the steepest, shortest wall at Currahee. It is highly featured but don't let that fool you, all of the climbs on this wall are above .9 with most falling in the .11 range. It offers sport, mixed, and trad. Most of the climbs can be easily top roped. This wall is also a good choice for warmer days due to the fact that it only gets afternoon sun. If you want to really bear down and crimp till your forearms pump out, this is the wall for you at Currahee.
